intro: Thlaspi valerianoides, commonly known as alpine penny-cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–20 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are pinnately divided and small, rounded flowers in clusters. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often found on rocky slopes and scree. Thlaspi valerianoides is adapted to cold climates and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience.
